actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs

actions.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 101-469.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 287.
Mr. Owens (UT) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

Subcommittee on Mineral Resources Development and Production

official_title: To provide for the exchange of certain Federal coal leases from the Alton Coal Field in the State of Utah for other Federal coal leases in that State.
short_title: Bryce Canyon Environmental Enhancement Act of 1990

summary.text: Bryce Canyon Environmental Enhancement Act of 1990 - Directs the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a competitive coal lease sale for an area in Utah that includes, at a minimum, the Manti-La Sal lands. Declares that the Alton coal lease holder is eligible to bid on such leases and receive them if it is the highest successful bidder and files a notice of intent to relinquish the Alton coal leases. Allocates payments received from coal lease payments, rentals, and royalties. Withdraws the relinquished Alton coal leases from coal leasing activities. Directs the Comptroller General to monitor implementation of this Act and report to specified congressional committees regarding the Secretary's compliance with prescribed lease sale guidelines.

titles.title: Bryce Canyon Environmental Enhancement Act of 1990

To provide for the exchange of certain Federal coal leases from the Alton Coal Field in the State of Utah for other Federal coal leases in that State.
